name: California Apprenticeship Initiative
description: Earn wages while learning skilled trades with industry certification upon completion
fullDescription: California's apprenticeship programs let you earn while you learn skilled trades. Get paid while receiving on-the-job training and classroom instruction leading to journey-level certification.
whatTheyOffer:
- Earn wages while training (typically starting at 40-50% of journey wage)
- On-the-job training with experienced workers
- Related classroom instruction
- Industry-recognized certification upon completion
- Career pathway to high-paying skilled trades
- Programs in construction, healthcare, IT, manufacturing, and more
howToGetIt:
1. Search for programs at dir.ca.gov/apprenticeship
2. Must be at least 18 (16 for some programs)
3. High school diploma or GED typically required
4. Apply directly to apprenticeship program or union
5. May need to pass aptitude test
6. Programs range from 1-5 years depending on trade
keywords: apprenticeship, apprentice, learn a trade, earn while you learn, journeyman, union, skilled trades, vocational, certification, construction, electrician, plumber
